reviews.title: abba rambla
reviews.text: Customer service was excellent. The TV wasn't working but they had an engineer up within 5 minutes of my phoning down to reception who fixed it straight away.

It is true that the location isn't the ritziest and glamourous in all of Central Barcelona as it is an area of immigrants. I didn't feel in the slightest bit intimidated there though (mind you, I have lived in some pretty scary places in my time!). The upside is that there is some very cheap shopping and supermarkets around and a good choice of cheap ethnic food such as kebabs and curries.
reviews.title: Great!

likes.disliked: — The undesirables on the surrounding streets...but even they weren't too bad. Always felt fairly safe!

description: Abba Rambla Hotel is set in the Raval District, 500 metres from Las Ramblas and Liceu Metro Station. It offers free Wi-Fi and a sun terrace. The modern, air-conditioned rooms at Abba Rambla feature satellite TV, a safe and minibar. The private bathroom comes with a hairdryer and amenities. Some rooms have a balcony with views. There is a café-bar, where guests can enjoy a buffet breakfast. Room service and a pizza delivery option are available. There is a 24-hour reception, and you can hire a bicycle or car from the tour desk. Parking can be reserved near the hotel for an additional charge. Attractions including La Boqueria Market and the MACBA Museum are 5 minutes’ walk away.
